Node.definition: = state in which an event is considered superior in quality to other events
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= state in which humans have a positive and compassionate attitude towards other humans
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= small, sharp pointed projections on the stem of a plant; ≈ associated with hardship
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: to be crooked (of a person); hence: = state in which humans lack integrity in everything they think or do

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= causative action by which humans make other humans acquainted with a procedure; ► so that they will eventually be able to perform that procedure himself
= a linker indicating that two propositions are proportional to one another in quantity, frequency, intensity, or content
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which humans are advanced in age, ≈ and the body is no longer able to function as before
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= to receive money or other valuables from someone else, which can be used for some time but is to be returned later, whether with interest or not; ≈ often associated with poverty
= to give money or other valuables to someone else, which can be used for some time but is to be returned later, whether with interest or not; ≈ often associated with wealth and acts of charity

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= state in which humans are suffering caused by difficult circumstances; ≈ often seen as the consequences of their own wickedness
literally: stick, rod; hence: = process of causing systematic suffering to someone else ◄ as if one were beating someone else with a rod

Node.gloss: to be finished|to be completed|to come to an end|to be past
Node.definition: = process by which an activity comes to full completion
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event stops taking place
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which humans or deities are free from moral contamination
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which words are uttered with a positive and compassionate attitude
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and strength
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare
= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads
= causative action by which humans take the life of other humans, whether or not intentionally
= hole in the ground; ◄ either natural or dug by humans; ► can be used to trap animals; ≈ associated with danger
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
literally: outsider (woman); = a woman who is the wife of someone else

Node.gloss: to express one's anger|to vent one's anger
Node.definition: = action by which deities or humans give free expression to their anger regarding someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
literally: to be tied in an object; = process by which an event continues to take place within a certain location
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
literally: to bend (one's) ear; hence: = action by which humans or deities make a conscious effort to listen to what (other) humans say
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= conditions and circumstances that have qualities that inspire appreciation
= action by which humans or deities persist in a certain activity
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

Node.gloss: to be established|to endure|to be secure
Node.definition: literally: to be established; hence: = process by which a condition becomes stable and can be expected to last for a long time
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= state in which a countable entity is thirty in number
= action by which humans exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which words are true and reliable
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to suffer harm and humiliation, ◄ which feels as if one has been crushed with a heavy object
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to plead (another's cause)|to defend|to take up (another's) cause
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities resolve a conflict for their own benefit or for the benefit of (other) humans who may not be in a position to do that for themselves

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
= to take or keep for one's own the possessions that belong to someone else; ≈ agent: human; goal: human, divine

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= to take or keep for one's own the possessions that belong to someone else; ≈ agent: human; goal: human, divine

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= action by which humans have some level of association with other humans
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= person engaged in a certain activity
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= to acquire knowledge of something
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= causative action by which someone strikes the palm of their hand against someone else's palm; ► in order to show that one has taken responsibility for someone else's debts; ≈ usually regarded as unwise
exact meaning unsure, possibly: = to strike the palm of one's hand against the hand of someone else usually a creditor to indicate that one has accepted the responsibility for another person's debt

Node.gloss: to pledge|to promise|to put up security
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which deities or humans in a position of authority establish a certain condition or pattern of events
= indirect male progenitor
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
literally: swift; hence: = state in which humans have a significant level of proficiency in a certain craft, which enables them to work relatively fast
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose
= process by which humans have little status within the society
